de.boereck.matcher.function.testable

Interface TestableToDoubleFunction<I>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - type of input to function
    All Superinterfaces:
    ToDoubleFunction<I>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface TestableToDoubleFunction<I>
extends ToDoubleFunction<I>
    To double function that provides more combinators than ToDoubleFunction. Especially interesting are function thenTest(DoublePredicate) to create a predicate based on the output of the function and the filter method filter(DoublePredicate) to create a function providing an optional, depending if the output of this function passes the given filter criterion or not.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Returns a composed function that first applies this function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result.

      Returns a composed function that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this function to the result.

      Returns a function that will call this function with its input and then check if the output fulfills predicate test.

      This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.function.ToDoubleFunction

        applyAsDouble

    • Method Detail

      • thenTest

        default AdvPredicate<I> thenTest(DoublePredicate test)
                          throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function first executing this function and then calling a test predicate on the result of this function.

        If this function or test will throw an exception when called by the returned predicate, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned predicate. If this function throws an exception the predicate test will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        test - predicate that will be used on the result of this function by the returned predicate. Must not be null
        Returns:
        predicate calling this function on its input and call predicate test with the output. The result of the call to test will be returned as the result.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • andThen

        default <V> TestableFunction<I,V> andThen(DoubleFunction<? extends V> after)
                                   throws NullPointerException
        Returns a composed function that first applies this function to its input, and then applies the after function to the result. If evaluation of either this function or after throws an exception, it is thrown to the caller of the composed function.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of output of the after function, and of the composed function
        Parameters:
        after - the function to apply after this function is applied
        Returns:
        a composed function that first applies this function and then applies the after function
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if after is null
        See Also:
        compose(Function)

      • compose

        default <V> TestableToDoubleFunction<V> compose(Function<? super V,? extends I> before)
        Returns a composed function that first applies the before function to its input, and then applies this function to the result. If evaluation of either this function or before throws an exception, it is thrown to the caller of the composed function.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the type of input to the before function, and to the composed function
        Parameters:
        before - the function to apply before this function is applied
        Returns:
        a composed function that first applies the before function and then applies this function
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - thrown if before is null
        See Also:
        andThen(DoubleFunction)

      • filter

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> filter(DoublePredicate test)
                                throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will call this function with its input and then check if the output fulfills predicate test. If the predicate is fulfilled (returned true), an optional containing the output if this function will be returned; if the predicate is not fulfilled, an empty optional will be returned.

        If this function or test will throw an exception when called by the returned function, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned function. If this function throws an exception the predicate test will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        test - predicate checking if the result of this function should be returned in an optional by the returned function, or if an empty optional should be returned.
        Returns:
        function filtering the result of this function, based on predicate test.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • thenDo

        default Consumer<I> thenDo(DoubleConsumer consumer)
                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that will take an input, call this function with it, and then call the given consumer with the result.

        If this function or consumer will throw an exception when called by the returned consumer, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned consumer. If this function throws an exception consumer will not be evaluated.

        Parameters:
        consumer - will be called by the returned consumer with the result of applying this function on its input.
        Returns:
        Consumer calling this function with its input and calling consumer with the result. Must not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if consumer is null.

      • requires

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> requires(Predicate<? super I> precondition)
                                  throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first check if its input fulfills precondition and if so returns an optional holding the result of calling this function with the input. If the precondition is not fulfilled, an empty optional will be returned without evaluating this function.

        If either this function or precondition will throw an exception when called by the returned function, this exception will be thrown to the caller of the returned function. If predicate throws an exception this function will not be called.

        Parameters:
        precondition - will be used in the returned function to check weather or not to call this function.
        Returns:
        function using precondition to decide weather or not to call this function with its input and return the result of that call.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException

      • nullAware

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> nullAware()
        This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this TestableToDoubleFunction and wrap the result in an OptionalDouble. Exceptions being thrown during the execution of this TestableToDoubleFunction will also be thrown at the caller of the returned function.
        Returns:
        function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this TestableToDoubleFunction and wrap the result in an OptionalDouble.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch()
        The returned function will execute this TestableToDoubleFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned as an OptionalDouble. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. It is recommended to handle the exception, e.g. by using method <E extends Throwable> withCatch(Class<E>, Consumer<E>) or withCatch(Consumer<Exception>) instead. In both cases an empty OptionalDouble is returned.
        Returns:
        function that will execute this TestableToDoubleFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case.

      • withCatch

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch(Class<E> clazz,
                                                                Consumer<E> handler)
                                                         throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this TestableToDoubleFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an throwable of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the Exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. Throwables of other types will be re-thrown. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of throwable to be caught
        Parameters:
        clazz - type of throwable to be caught
        handler - consumer handling the throwable
        Returns:
        function that will execute this TestableToDoubleFunction and potentially handling exceptions of type clazz with handler. After handling exceptions, the function will return an empty OptionalDouble.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or handler is null.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> withCatch(Consumer<Exception> handler)
                                   throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this TestableToDoubleFunction and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        handler - will handle exceptions being thrown during the execution of this TestableToDoubleFunction
        Returns:
        function execution this TestableToDoubleFunction and if execution performs without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalDouble in this case.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler is null.

      • recoverWith

        default TestableToDoubleFunction<I> recoverWith(ToDoubleFunction<? super Throwable> recovery)
                                         throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this TestableToDoubleFunction and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalDouble should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        recovery - method providing a regular result value if the TestableToDoubleFunction throws an exception.
        Returns:
        function executing this TestableToDoubleFunction and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalDouble should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if recovery is null.

      • recoverWith

        default <E extends Throwable> TestableToDoubleFunction<I> recoverWith(Class<E> clazz,
                                                                      ToDoubleFunction<? super E> recovery)
                                                               throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this TestableToDoubleFunction and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        recovery - function recovering from an exception providing a regular value to return from the returned function.
        Returns:
        function executing this TestableToDoubleFunction and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or recovery is null.
